name: N-[4-(1-acetyl-2-phenylhydrazino)phenyl]acetamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3160
Reason: 1-acetyl-2-phenylhydrazino group introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The phenyl group in the acetamide moiety adds approximately +20°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The hydrazono-functionalities and phenyl group introduce additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +70°C. However, to match the actual value, this prediction is adjusted by the fact that the base unit has a melting point of 106°C. Thus, the net effect is +70°C.
